properties.name: Arbor Court Apartments
properties.description: Posted by Jdchandler1329 sw 14th, Portland ORNovember 20, 1933 -- W. Frank Akin, independent auditor working for Governor Meier, shot to death. This is one of Portland\'s great mysteries and most historians say that it was never solved. One man was convicted of murder in this case and the person who pulled the trigger was probably executed for another crime. Soon I will tell this forgotten story.

properties.name: Face Off With a Dog
properties.description: Posted by Jdchandlercumbaya, ecuador1994 - Hiking with fellow students in this area, before it was so built up. We came around a corner and could see a dog alert and start charging us straight down the road. He was still a long way off, so we stopped. I had already got used to carrying a couple of good sized rocks where ever I went. The dogs in Ecuador are quite "thrilling". I waited until the dog was in range and the gods smiled on me that day. My rock hit the road directly in front of the dog, bouncing up into his chest. The dog stopped in his tracks, turned around and ran the other way. We turned around and went back they way we came and then found a nice spot on the river to drink some wine and bask in our victory.

properties.name: Fong Home
properties.description: Posted by Jdchandler3405 SW Barbur, Portland ORFebruary 2, 1954 -- Diane Hank, 16, died after a drinking party in the home of local nighclub owner Way Hin (Wayne) Fong and his wife Shari. Her body was found dumped along the side of the Evergreen Highway near Washougal WA.

The Tire Shop was at the corner of SW 13th and Alder. When police arrived Lynch ran around the corner onto 14th and was shot in front of 925 SW 14th which is a parking lot next to an apartment building now. It was probably another apartment building in 1948.

In 1968 his home was raided and lots of stolen goods were found. Elkins died mysteriously a few months later.

Kelly was also badly wounded. He was captured a short time after the shooting and died the next day. Officer Hewston recovered.
